etymologies: mid 19th century: from French bésigue, perhaps from Persian bāzīgar ‘juggler’ or bāzī ‘game’

definitions: a trick-taking card game for two, played with a double pack of 64 cards, including the seven to ace only in each suit.
shortDefinitions: trick-taking card game for two, played with double pack of 64 cards

definitions: the holding of the queen of spades and the jack of diamonds in this game.
shortDefinitions: holding of queen of spades and jack of diamonds in bezique
